item.title: Xpeng Shares Rise Sharply Amid Launch of Lower-Priced G6 Model
item.description: Electric vehicle company XPeng Inc.’s Hong Kong-listed shares were sharply higher, after the company announced the launch of its new G6 sport-utility vehicle.

item.title: Eurozone YTD Government Bond Issuance Run-Rate Seen Ahead of 2022
item.description: Eurozone sovereigns’ government bond issuance for 2023 is progressing marginally quicker than in 2022, Barclays said, as supply year-to-date is €783 billion which represents an aggregate of around 60% of planned issuance for 2023.

item.title: Eurozone Inflation Data Unlikely to Support Euro
item.description: The euro failed to benefit from higher-than-expected German inflation data on Thursday and this doesn’t bode well for the common currency ahead of eurozone inflation figures later, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Metals Mixed Amid China Demand Headwinds
item.description: Metal prices were mixed as worries over Chinese demand continue to dominate the market.

item.title: Oil Remains Range Bound Amid Expectations of Further Rate Hikes
item.description: Oil prices were moving higher, amid more positive economic data coming from the U.S.

item.title: French Inflation Dropped More Than Expected
item.description: France’s inflation rate fell more than expected in June, reaching its lowest level since March 2022, as fuel and food prices continued to ease.

item.title: Engie Raises Outlook on Strength of Global Energy Management and Sales
item.description: Engie increased its 2023 earnings guidance on Friday due to the strength of its global energy management and sales business.

item.title: UK Economy Expanded Slightly, Matching First Estimates
item.description: The U.K. economy grew marginally in the first quarter of 2023, matching previous estimates, as a cost-of-living crisis impacted by high inflation and rising interest rates weighed on economic activity.

item.title: Nikkei Falls 0.1%, Dragged by Pharma Stocks, Trading Houses
item.description: Japanese stocks ended slightly lower, dragged by falls in pharmaceutical stocks and trading houses, as signs of U.S. economic strength rekindled concerns about the scope of policy tightening by central banks.

item.title: SVB Depositors Who Lost Their Money Win Court Victory
item.description: Silicon Valley Bank’s customers in the Cayman Islands weren’t covered by a U.S. deposit guarantee program.

item.title: UK Car Manufacturing Rises for Fourth Consecutive Month
item.description: U.K. car production rose 27% in May, with hybrid and BEV volumes representing 35% of all cars made.

item.title: China's Economy Shows New Signs of Weakness
item.description: Evidence of China’s flagging growth continues to roll in, raising questions about whether the government is doing enough to turn things around.

item.title: China Far Outranks the U.S in High-Speed Rail. Here's Why.
item.description: China has some of the fastest – and busiest – trains in the world. But despite having some of the same technology, the U.S. has struggled to develop its own high-speed rail. WSJ explores the barriers hindering its development.

item.title: As China Reopens Borders, Trafficking of Women and Girls Resumes
item.description: Covid restrictions had mostly halted the smuggling of Vietnamese women for marriage to Chinese men.

item.title: Markets' Monster 2023 Rally Defied All Expectations
item.description: Stocks burst out of a bear market, with the Nasdaq Composite up 30% and on course for its best first half of a year since the 1980s.

item.title: Virgin Galactic completed its effort to take paying customers for the first time to the edge of space, almost two years after it was originally scheduled as a test flight.
item.description: Virgin Galactic completed its effort to take paying customers for the first time to the edge of space, almost two years after it was originally scheduled as a test flight.

item.title: The S&P 500 rose 0.4%, while the Dow industrials added 0.8%. The Nasdaq finished nearly unchanged, but still on course to set its best first half of a year on record.
item.description: The S&P 500 rose 0.4%, while the Dow industrials added 0.8%. The Nasdaq finished nearly unchanged, but still on course to set its best first half of a year on record.

item.title: At least half of the U.S. experienced difficult weather conditions Thursday, with the Northeast and the Midwest smothered by Canadian wildfire smoke and the South sweltering in a relentless heat wave.
item.description: At least half of the U.S. experienced difficult weather conditions Thursday, with the Northeast and the Midwest smothered by Canadian wildfire smoke and the South sweltering in a relentless heat wave.

item.title: The court limited the reach of federal trademark law, making it harder for U.S. companies to sue foreign rivals who sell copycat products abroad.
item.description: The court limited the reach of federal trademark law, making it harder for U.S. companies to sue foreign rivals who sell copycat products abroad.

item.title: Some females who sought jobs at Bill Gates's private office encountered a screening process that included explicit questions by a security firm about their sexual histories, according to the candidates and people familiar with the hiring process.
item.description: Some females who sought jobs at Bill Gates’s private office encountered a screening process that included explicit questions by a security firm about their sexual histories, according to the candidates and people familiar with the hiring process.
